attributes.action: Secure the right of citizens to speak without being oppressed by the government.
attributes.additional_details: America understood the value of Freedom of Speech centuries ago when it wrote the first amendment, and it is high time that the United Kingdom followed in its footsteps, creating a constitutional law that prohibits the government (and thus, police) from imprisoning or otherwise persecuting any individual for what they say. "Hateful" speech should be challenged with words, not force.
attributes.background: Freedom of Speech is one of the core tenets of The Enlightenment and post-theocratic western values. It secures people the right to say as they wish without being imprisoned or persecuted for it. Today thousands are arrested for tweets and speech deemed offensive, a gross violation of their rights.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
